content.description: LEADING TO THE FIRST BOLT GETS A LITTLE DICY. Other then that fun route.
content.location: To the right of "forget about it"

content.description: This is the second route from the right.  Follow the line of bolts past fun moves to a nice two bolt anchor.
content.location: This route is 10' left of Unknown Sport Route I.

content.description: Low first bolt can (and should) be clipped from the ground.  Hard compression moves through an overhanging scoop transition to thin balancey slab.  Wear a shirt so the juniper doesn't scratch your back!
Begin in a shallow corner before gaining a slabby face. Stay right at the arete and climb big holds to pass a runout section below the anchors.
content.protection: 4 bolts and anchors. Rings to lower on reachable anchors to the left.
content.location: Between the unnamed 12+ arete and the northwest facing 10+ Lizard Liquor; this route starts behind two juniper trees.

content.description: Located on the Southwest facing portion of the cliff this is the furthest right hand route.  Climb past five or six clips through a small roof to a nice two bolt rap anchor.  The anchor is located just below a small ledge which can be used to access the anchors on most of the routes on this cliff.
content.protection: 5 bolts and a two-bolt rap station.

content.description:
< to be filled out >

 Please submit an edit or leave a comment!
content.location: In between "Pink Hot Tub" and "Lizard Liquor".

content.description: short technical
content.location: 1 minute down trail from the southwest facing main wall. Kind of hidden in the corner behind juniper trees

content.description: Crimpy face climbing past 5 bolts
content.location: Blank-looking bolted face to the left of "Burning Desire".

content.description: Quality hand holds off the ground take you toward small crimps with minimal rests.
content.protection: 6 bolts and a 'bailer' at the anchors.
content.location: Second route from the left at the Main (Just at the top of the approach trail) Firewall. Unpainted Chrome Bolts.

content.description: A v1 boulder problem guards the entry onto an impeccable gray cracky face.  Once established, some techy slab moves are still between you an the anchors.  Honestly I felt that this was a little tough for 10a, but who am I to start upgrading routes at a new area.
content.location: Next route right of Hangey Timey.  There is an obvious roof right at the start.

content.description:
Located on the Northwest facing portion of the Anvil Wall, Jam Session is the splitter crack at the far left end.  Thin hands to hands to large hands/fists to a large sloping ledge with two bolts.  Rappel or scramble to the climber's left to walk off.  

  This is a good place to teach someone how to jam because the crack is short and offers a variety of widths to practice on.
content.protection: 1 x #1, #2, #3 Camalot   or   Scramble up and left to set a TR from the two bolt rap anchor.

content.description: Neat movement through concave feature halfway up route.  Cruxy move right before anchors.
content.location: Located on a southwestern facing section of crag at the left side of the fire wall.  Start of the route is to the left of the hueco features used for pink hot tub.

content.description: Follow a line of 5 bolts up a solid gray face just to the left of break in the cliff face.  The crux is reachy, and may be harder for those with shorter wingspans.  It involves reaching out from a stance in the crack/gulley and moving left onto the face.  Some flakey crimps get you to the top from here.
content.location: Just around the corner (right) from “You Wanna Piece of Me”.  There is a pine tree at the base of the route.

content.description: great route, crux in near the top bolt.
content.location: First route to the left of "you wanna peace of me" and the next bolt line to the right of "Dirty hard to reach areas.

content.description: Climba seam/crack start to a dishy face.

Very different feel than it’s 10a neighbor to the left.  This climb requires some body English as you quasi-jam and stem your way up the short crack/corner.  Not sure if necessary, but I threw a few chicken wings moves in there for good measure.
content.location: About 20’ right of lefty loosey in an obvious corner.

content.description: Awesome crack climb.
content.location: next line of bolts to the Left of Forget about it.

content.description: Thin and Crimpy
content.location: Located on southwest facing section of crag on the left end of the fire wall.

content.description: Start in the short bolted crack and move into a hard sequence of crimpy face holds.  Middle section is both pumpy and technical.
content.location: Located on a southwest facing section of the crag containing a handful of bolted routes. Starts in a short bolted crack.  Second route to the left at the fire wall.

content.description:
A nice crag very close to the road with short but fun sport routes in the 5.7-5.12 range, plus some cool bouldering on the way in to boot.  Scattered pine trees give shade when needed but most routes appear to stay in the sun most of the day.  Crag walls face west/southwest.  Oak Creek runs nearby if you need to cool down on the way out...but I've heard you should not drink the water! 

  This area is described in the Red Lizard II guide, although I have never personally looked at it; furthermore, it is apparently out of date as many new routes have been added.
